intro: Tubella moschata, commonly known as the musk tuber, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the spring. Its tubers are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
